issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
When working on HIVE-14799, I noticed there were some RuntimeException when running explainanalyze_3.q and explainanalyze_5.q, though these tests shew successful.

fields.summary: RuntimeException was seen in explainanalyze_3.q test log

comments.body:
In Hive qtests, there is a query PreExecute hook EnforceReadOnlyTables which enforces that all test sources tables (e.g. src) should not be written, otherwise it throws the RuntimeException as we saw in the log. 
But the query like "explain analyze analyze table src compute statistics" in explainanalyze_3.q, or 5.q set query table src as a WriteEntity in its process for the replication reason (see comments in SemanticAnalyzer.setupStats(..))
[~pxiong] Is the query "explain analyze analyze table src compute statistics" in those tests only for testing the explain analyze for column stats commands, or is there any other uses? Could you review the patch? Thanks
Thanks a lot [~ctang.ma], the patch LGTM. +1 pending QA tests.
The tests are only for testing the explain analyze purpose.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12832745/HIVE-14930.patch
